midas/examples/slowcont/frontend.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         frontend.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Example Slow Control Frontend program. Defines two
00007                 slow control equipments, one for a HV device and one
00008                 for a multimeter (usually a general purpose PC plug-in
00009                 card with A/D inputs/outputs. As a device driver,
00010                 the "null" driver is used which simulates a device
00011                 without accessing any hardware. The used class drivers
00012                 cd_hv and cd_multi act as a link between the ODB and
00013                 the equipment and contain some functionality like
00014                 ramping etc. To form a fully functional frontend,
00015                 the device driver "null" has to be replaces with
00016                 real device drivers.
00017 
00018 
00019   $Log: frontend.c,v $

00057 #include <stdio.h>
00058 #include "midas.h"
00059 #include "class/hv.h"
00060 #include "class/multi.h"
00061 #include "device/nulldev.h"
00062 #include "bus/null.h"
00063 
00064 /*-- Globals -------------------------------------------------------*/
00065 
00066 /* The frontend name (client name) as seen by other MIDAS clients   */
00067 char *frontend_name = "SC Frontend";
00068 /* The frontend file name, don't change it */
00069 char *frontend_file_name = __FILE__;
00070 
00071 /* frontend_loop is called periodically if this variable is TRUE    */
00072 BOOL frontend_call_loop = FALSE;
00073 
00074 /* a frontend status page is displayed with this frequency in ms    */
00075 INT display_period = 1000;
00076 
00077 /* maximum event size produced by this frontend */
00078 INT max_event_size = 10000;
00079 
00080 /* maximum event size for fragmented events (EQ_FRAGMENTED) */
00081 INT max_event_size_frag = 5 * 1024 * 1024;
00082 
00083 /* buffer size to hold events */
00084 INT event_buffer_size = 10 * 10000;
00085 
00086 /*-- Equipment list ------------------------------------------------*/
00087 
00088 /* device driver list */
00089 DEVICE_DRIVER hv_driver[] = {
00090    {"Dummy Device", nulldev, 16, null},
00091    {""}
00092 };
00093 
00094 DEVICE_DRIVER multi_driver[] = {
00095    {"Input", nulldev, 2, null, DF_INPUT},
00096    {"Output", nulldev, 2, null, DF_OUTPUT},
00097    {""}
00098 };
00099 
00100 
00101 EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00102 
00103    {"HV",                       /* equipment name */
00104     3, 0,                       /* event ID, trigger mask */
00105     "SYSTEM",                   /* event buffer */
00106     EQ_SLOW,                    /* equipment type */
00107     0,                          /* event source */
00108     "FIXED",                    /* format */
00109     TRUE,                       /* enabled */
00110     RO_RUNNING | RO_TRANSITIONS,        /* read when running and on transitions */
00111     60000,                      /* read every 60 sec */
00112     0,                          /* stop run after this event limit */
00113     0,                          /* number of sub events */
00114     1,                          /* log history every event */
00115     "", "", "",
00116     cd_hv_read,                 /* readout routine */
00117     cd_hv,                      /* class driver main routine */
00118     hv_driver,                  /* device driver list */
00119     NULL,                       /* init string */
00120     },
00121 
00122    {"Environment",              /* equipment name */
00123     4, 0,                       /* event ID, trigger mask */
00124     "SYSTEM",                   /* event buffer */
00125     EQ_SLOW,                    /* equipment type */
00126     0,                          /* event source */
00127     "FIXED",                    /* format */
00128     TRUE,                       /* enabled */
00129     RO_RUNNING | RO_TRANSITIONS,        /* read when running and on transitions */
00130     60000,                      /* read every 60 sec */
00131     0,                          /* stop run after this event limit */
00132     0,                          /* number of sub events */
00133     1,                          /* log history every event */
00134     "", "", "",
00135     cd_multi_read,              /* readout routine */
00136     cd_multi,                   /* class driver main routine */
00137     multi_driver,               /* device driver list */
00138     NULL,                       /* init string */
00139     },
00140 
00141    {""}
00142 };
